contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{otherships|USS Accomac|USS Algonquin|}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= [[Image:USS Algonquin (1898-1946).jpg|300px|USS ''Algonquin'' (1898–1946) At the New York Navy Yard, Brooklyn, New York, circa April 1898. Note 6mm Colt Machinegun and 13-star boat flag aft, and horse cart on pier]] |Ship caption=USS ''Algonquin'' (1898–1946) At the New York Navy Yard, Brooklyn, New York, circa April 1898. Note 6mm Colt Machinegun and 13-star boat flag aft, and horse cart on pier }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1946}} |Ship name=USS ''Accomac'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Northrop Grumman Newport News|Newport News Shipbuilding]], [[Newport News, Virginia]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=1891, as ''El Toro'' |Ship acquired=by purchase, 26 March 1898 |Ship commissioned=2 April 1898, as USS ''Algonquin'' |Ship decommissioned=3 April 1946 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=17 April 1946 |Ship renamed=''Accomac'', 15 June 1898<br/>''Nottoway'', 1918<br/>''YT-18'', 1942<br/>''YTL-18'', 1944 |Ship reclassified=YT-18, 17 July 1920 |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship fate=Sold, 15 October 1946 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[Tugboat]] |Ship displacement= {{convert|187|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} |Ship length= {{convert|90|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|19|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|9|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= {{convert|10|kn|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement=12 |Ship armament=1 × 6-pounder gun |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} The first '''USS ''Accomac'' (YT-18/YTL-18)''' was a small [[tugboat|harbor tug]] in the service of the [[United States Navy]], named after [[Accomac, Virginia]]. She was built as the Steam Tug '''''El Toro''''' at [[Newport News, Virginia]] by [[Northrop Grumman Newport News|Newport News Shipbuilding]], and purchased by the Navy on 26 March 1898 because of the impending [[Spanish–American War|war with Spain]]. She was renamed '''USS ''Algonquin''''', and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 2 April 1898 with [[Ensign (rank)|Ensign]] [[W. S. Crowley]] in command. After being outfitted at the [[New York Navy Yard]], the tug reported for duty with the [[North Atlantic Squadron]] at its base at [[Key West, Florida]] on 13 April. On 15 June 1898, she was renamed '''USS ''Accomac'''''. The vessel served at Key West through end of the year. In January 1899, she was reassigned to the [[Cuba]]n occupation forces and was based at [[Havana, Cuba]]. Between late 1900 and December 1911, the small ship successively served as a yard tug at [[Port Royal, South Carolina]], Key West, and [[Pensacola, Florida]]. On 4 December 1911, ''Accomac'' arrived at the [[Boston Navy Yard]] where she spent the remainder of her active career. In 1918 she was renamed '''USS ''Nottoway''''', and in July 1920, when the Navy adopted the alphanumeric system of [[hull classification symbol|hull designations]], ''Nottoway'' received the hull number "YT-18". On 5 October 1942, her name was cancelled, and she became simply '''''YT-18'''''. On 15 May 1944, the tug was redesignated a small harbor tug, '''''YTL-18'''''. She served at Boston as a yard tug through the end of [[World War II]]. ''YTL-18'' was placed out of service at Boston on 3 April 1946, and her name was struck from the [[Naval Vessel Register|Navy List]] on 17 April 1946. On 15 October 1946, she was sold to Mr. Arthur M. Hall, of Boston, Massachusetts, presumably for scrapping. == References == *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/a2/accomac-i.htm|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/n6/nottoway-i.htm}} ==External links== * {{navsource|14/08018|USS Algonquin/Accomac/Nottoway}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Accomac}} [[Category:Spanish–American War auxiliary ships of the United States]] [[Category:Tugs of the United States Navy]] [[Category:1891 ships]] [[Category:Ships built in Newport News, Virginia]]
